abstract.p: Princeton Artists Alliance will hold demonstrations and auction at 1860 House in Skillman, NJ, to benefit historic house (S)

block.p: In a nice bit of interconnectedness, Princeton-area artists are offering an unusual event today to benefit a historic house, which is in turn hoping to create create something that will benefit the dramatic arts.

From 1 to 4 p.m., the Princeton Artists Alliance, a group of about 20 artists, is holding ''Artists in Action'' at the 1860 House, a restored building at 124 Montgomery Road in Skillman that serves as a cultural center for the area. Members of the alliance will be showing how they do what they do, in painting, photography, pottery and other areas. The spectrum will be broad -- as Clem Fiori demonstrates woodworking with vintage tools, Madelaine Shellaby and Ruane Miller will be showing how to create and alter digital images. Visitors will get a chance to try some of the techniques.

In a nice bit of interconnectedness, Princeton-area artists are offering an unusual event today to benefit a historic house, which is in turn hoping to create create something that will benefit the dramatic arts.

From 1 to 4 p.m., the Princeton Artists Alliance, a group of about 20 artists, is holding ''Artists in Action'' at the 1860 House, a restored building at 124 Montgomery Road in Skillman that serves as a cultural center for the area. Members of the alliance will be showing how they do what they do, in painting, photography, pottery and other areas. The spectrum will be broad -- as Clem Fiori demonstrates woodworking with vintage tools, Madelaine Shellaby and Ruane Miller will be showing how to create and alter digital images. Visitors will get a chance to try some of the techniques.
The $10 admission (children under 12 are free) will go to benefit the 1860 House. Mr. McVicker said the specific goal is to raise money for a project to help turn a barn into a small theater.
